replies.author: fjtirado

timeline.body: @fjtirado this is resolved at compile time right, so why dont we inject a DefaultEventMarshaller or CloudEventMarshaller depending on that so we dont need to check at runtime? Instead we would have to concrete classes. Wouldnt that make things easier in the code we have to maintain?
timeline.bodyText: @fjtirado this is resolved at compile time right, so why dont we inject a DefaultEventMarshaller or CloudEventMarshaller depending on that so we dont need to check at runtime? Instead we would have to concrete classes. Wouldnt that make things easier in the code we have to maintain?
timeline.bodyHTML: @fjtirado this is resolved at compile time right, so why dont we inject a DefaultEventMarshaller or CloudEventMarshaller depending on that so we dont need to check at runtime? Instead we would have to concrete classes. Wouldnt that make things easier in the code we have to maintain?
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText:
Im afraid this is not resolved at compilation time (I agree that it will be far easier if it was)
See generated code
@org.eclipse.microprofile.config.inject.ConfigProperty(name = "kogito.messaging.as-cloudevents")
this is decided by configuration at runtime
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText: yep, you're right. Although I feel that is something that could be defined at compile time, but that's another story.
replies.author: cristianonicolai
